main event: A disc-shaped metallic gray object, approximately 500 yards in diameter, was seen traveling nearly parallel to the horizon in St. Louis, Missouri on September 17, 1957.
interesting points: The object made a steep climb and disappeared after being observed for approximately 20-25 seconds.
The object was described as having a whistling or humming sound.
The object exhibited erratic maneuvers that would be very difficult for a conventional aircraft.
Multiple sightings of similar objects were reported in the area around the same time.
The weather conditions included a light rain shower in the area at the approximate time of the incident.
witnesses: civilian graduate student in Chemistry at Washington University
